      • getObject

        Return the object being approved.

      • getObjectClass

        public java.lang.String getObjectClass(WorkflowContext wfc)
        Return the simple class name of the object being aproved. If this is a Bundle instance, "Role" is returned.

      • getObjectName

        public java.lang.String getObjectName(WorkflowContext wfc)
        Return the name of the object being approved.

      • getCurrentObject

        public SailPointObject getCurrentObject(WorkflowContext wfc)
                                 throws GeneralException
        Get the current persistent version of the object we're holding in the workflow case.

        This assumes that the object is stored in the "approvalObject" variable.

        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getObjectOwner

        public Identity getObjectOwner(WorkflowContext wfc)
                        throws GeneralException
        Return the owner of the object being approved. Note that this is the current owner, which may be different from the owner set in the approval object.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getNewObjectOwner

        public Identity getNewObjectOwner(WorkflowContext wfc)
        Return the new object owner. This may be different than the identity returned by ApprovalLibrary.getObjectOwner(sailpoint.workflow.WorkflowContext) since the owner may have changed.

      • getObjectOwnerName

        public java.lang.String getObjectOwnerName(WorkflowContext wfc)
                                    throws GeneralException
        Return the name of the owner of the object being approved.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getNewObjectOwnerName

        public java.lang.String getNewObjectOwnerName(WorkflowContext wfc)
        Return just the name of the new object owner.

      • isOwnerChange

        public boolean isOwnerChange(WorkflowContext wfc)
                      throws GeneralException
        Return true if the object being approved has had an owner change.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • isSelfApproval

        public boolean isSelfApproval(WorkflowContext wfc)
                       throws GeneralException
        Return true if the user launching the workflow is the same as the owner of the object being approved.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getMessage

        public static java.lang.String getMessage(java.lang.String key,
                          java.lang.Object arg)
        Localize a message.

      • getStringList

        protected static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStringList(java.lang.Object value)
        Coerce the given value into a list of strings. The value of the selections argument can be one of: - String - List Further, each String can be a CSV.
        Ignore design notes (see ExcludeDoclet)
        Created for the ARG_SELECTIONS argument used with remediateViolation but relatively general. Items returned by getRemediatables will be CSVs, and since you can select both left and right sides the selection may be a List of CSVs. We need to flatten all this into a list of role names for remediation.
